isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS CELECT - 1992-1993 - DIAGNOSTICS

svcsubsecinfo.para: All CELECT vehicles have a yellow "Engine Warning" light and a red "Engine Stop" light located in the telltale lights in the instrument cluster. Every time the key is turned to the ignition position, the lights come on for several seconds as a system self-test and then turn off.

If the warning lights remain on, it is an indication that the ECM has detected a problem. The CELECT system can show and record certain problems. The problems are shown as fault codes. The fault codes are recorded in the ECM.

note.para: All engine or CELECT problems are NOT shown as fault codes.
